scam_name: Digital Payment Fraud / Online Financial Scam
channel: Mobile applications (UPI, banking apps), SMS, Phone calls, Social Media, Email
modus_operandi: Scammers impersonate bank officials, government agencies, or customer support. They create urgency or fear (e.g., 'account blocked,' 'KYC update required,' 'lottery win,' 'job offer'). They then trick victims into sharing OTPs, PINs, or downloading remote access apps, or directly transferring money to fraudulent accounts under false pretenses.
red_flags: Unsolicited requests for sensitive financial information (OTP, PIN, CVV, passwords)
Pressure to act immediately or face negative consequences
Requests to download unknown apps or grant remote access
Promises of large sums of money for little effort (e.g., lottery, prize money)
Grammar/spelling mistakes or unprofessional language in communications
Sender's identity not matching official sources (e.g., generic email, suspicious phone number)
Requests to transfer money to an unknown account for 'verification' or 'fees'
recommended_user_action: Never share OTP, PIN, CVV, or passwords with anyone. Verify the identity of the caller/sender through official channels (e.g., bank's official website/helpline). Do not click on suspicious links. Do not download unknown apps. Report suspicious activity to your bank and cybercrime authorities immediately.
example_message: Dear customer, your bank account will be blocked within 24 hours due to incomplete KYC. Please click on [malicious link] to update immediately or call our support at [fake number] to avoid account suspension. Do not ignore this urgent message.
